details.title: Iconic actor Soumitra Chatterjee critical but stable
details.content:
The Dada Saheb Phalke awardee had been admitted to the medical facility on October 6 after testing positive for COVID-19.
(READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: Economy poised to reach pre-COVID-19 levels by 2020 end: Finance Ministry
details.content:
Indian economy is poised to recover at a fast pace and reach pre-COVID-19 levels by the end of the year, the finance ministry said in its monthly report but also cautioned about the possibility of "fatigue with social distancing norms" triggering a second wave of coronavirus infections.
(READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: Bengal reports record recovery of 4,129 COVID patients .
details.content: West Bengal on Wednesday registered the highest single-day recovery of 4,129 COVID-19 patients, taking the total number of cured people to 3,46,262, the health department said in a bulletin. The discharge rate now is 88. 88 per cent. The death toll mounted to 7,068 after 55 more people succumbed to the disease.

details.title: US records more than 99,000 new COVID-19 cases a day after presidential polls
details.content:
The country reported 99,660 new infections between 8:30 pm Tuesday and 8:30 pm Wednesday (0130 GMT), and 1,112 deaths, the tally by John-Hopkins University showed one day after Americans voted to choose their next president. 

More than 9.4 million people have been infected and 233,000 have died in the United States so far during the pandemic, by far the worst tolls in absolute terms globally.

details.title: Puducherry reports 125 new cases
details.content:
Puducherry reports 125 new #COVID19 infections taking total cases to 35,550 out of which 1,829 are active patients.

Total 596 deaths reported so far. pic.twitter.com/IMvXYOYVsK

— ANI (@ANI) November 5, 2020

details.title: COVID-19: SC asks Centre to issue directions for ban on disinfectants and ultraviolet rays on humans
details.content:
The Supreme Court on Thursday asked the Centre to issue directions for banning use of disinfectants and ultraviolet rays on humans for COVID-19 management. A bench headed by Justice Ashok Bhushan asked the government to do the needful in this regard within a month.

The bench passed the verdict on a plea seeking directions to the Centre to forthwith ban the installation, production and advertisement of disinfection tunnels involving spraying or fumigation of chemical disinfectants on humans. (READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: As Covid-19 cases fall, Kovai witnesses drop in containment zones
details.content: The number of containment zones in Coimbatore has dropped sharply from 113 last week to just 40 this week. This follows the decline in fresh Covid-19 cases reported from the city over the past week. According to officials at the Coimbatore corporation, this is the first time in the last four months that the city has recorded a drop in the number of containment zones. (READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: COVID-19 plasma therapy helping to prevent deaths: Experts
details.content:
Many hospitals, which were opted by ICMR in its trial phase, have continued the therapy which helped to reduce deaths among the Covid-19 infected patients. Some hospitals have completed more than a hundred therapies. In Hubballi KIMS has completed 103 plasma therapies out of which 15 patients died.

Sources at KIMS said their institute has been conducting plasma therapy on moderate patients only. Due to some external pressure, they conducted the therapy on some severe patients, who had not matched criteria to get plasma, and all 15 deaths took place in such severe patients. (READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: Johns Hopkins, IIHMR University to offer online courses on 'vaccine economics'
details.content: The Johns Hopkins Bloomberg School of Public Health has partnered with IIHMR University in Jaipur to offer two online courses on "vaccine economics" for policymakers and programme managers to educate them on optimising vaccine coverage during the COVID-19 pandemic.

details.title: Puducherry reports 125 fresh COVID-19 cases, one fatality
details.content: The union territory of Puducherry added 125 fresh COVID-19 cases taking the overall tally to 35,550 while one death pushed the toll close to 600, a top Health department official said on Thursday.

details.title: Another Odisha journalist dies of COVID-19
details.content: Another journalist died of COVID-19 in Odisha on Thursday. Prabir Pradhan, a senior reporter of an Odia news channel, died at a hospital in Bhubaneswar, his family said.

details.title: 262 students test positive after schools reopen in Andhra Pradesh
details.content: As many as 262 students and about 160 teachers tested positive in Andhra Pradesh during the past three days after schools were reopened on November 2 for class 9 and 10 students, a senior official of the school education said on Thursday.

details.title: Delhi can soon become 'corona capital', AAP government going haywire on pandemic: High Court
details.content: The High Court said the Delhi government made many claims that they are topping charts in testing but the number of cases have overshot. (READ MORE)

details.title: JD(S) leader Bandeppa Kashempur tests positive for COVID-19
details.content: JD(S) deputy leader in the Karnataka legislative assembly Bandeppa Kashempur on Thursday said he has tested positive for COVID-19 infection.

details.title: Kerala government to offer financial aid to struggling artists due to COVID-19 restrictions
details.content: The Kerala government has announced a financial assistance of Rs 1000 to artists and performers facing crisis during the COVID-19 pandemicas there was no programme or work for them due to the restrictions imposed.

details.title: We've to fight this battle together & win together: High Commissioner of India to Bangladesh
details.content: Delighted by MoU b/w Serum Institute India, Beximco Pharma & Health Ministry for 30mn doses of COVID vaccine. PM said in March, 'neighbourhood collaboration should be model for world. We've to fight this battle together & win together': High Commissioner of India to Bangladesh

details.title: Global economic fallout of COVID-19 will continue to remain a challenge: Foreign Secretary Harsh Vardhan Shringla
details.content: The global economic fallout of the coronavirus pandemic will continue to remain a challenge and India has been looking at it not as constraints but as an opportunity for its economy as well as rebalancing of the international system, Foreign Secretary Harsh Vardhan Shringla said on Thursday.

details.content:

— ANI (@ANI) November 5, 2020

details.title: China temporarily suspends entry of foreign nationals in India holding valid Chinese visas
details.content: Due to COVID-19, China temporarily suspends entry of foreign nationals in India holding valid Chinese visas or residence permits. Chinese Embassy/Consulates in India will not stamp Health Declaration Forms for holders of the above-mentioned categories: Chinese Embassy in India

details.title: 524 new COVID-19 cases reported in J&K today
details.content: 524 new COVID-19 cases (185 from Jammu & 339 from Kashmir), 651 recoveries & 6 deaths reported from J&K today. Total positive cases now at 97,224, including 5,802 active cases, 89,905 recoveries & 1,517 deaths: J&K government

details.title: Dharavi reports single COVID-19 case on second consecutive day
details.content: The COVID-19 tally in Mumbai slum colony of Dharavi increased to 3,570 with the addition of one new case on Thursday, a senior BMC official said. This was the second consecutive day when the slum- dominated area has reported just one COVID-19 case.

details.title: 28 more deaths, 1,879 new cases in Uttar Pradesh
details.content: The COVID-19 death toll in Uttar Pradesh reached 7,131 after 28 more people succumbed to the disease, while 1,879 fresh cases pushed the tally to 4,91,354, Principal Secretary, Medical and Health, Alok Kumar said on Thursday.

details.title: Facilitate meetings between prisoners, their families while following COVID protocols
details.content: Prison authorities in Jammu and Kashmir should facilitate meeting of inmates languishing in various jails with their family members while maintaining proper COVID-19 protocols, CPI(M) leader Mohammad Yousuf Tarigami said here on Thursday.

details.title: Punjab reports 541 new COVID-19 cases and 22 deaths today

details.title: Delhi High Court extends by 30 days interim bail of over 3,300 under-trial prisoners
details.content: The Delhi High Court on Thursday extended the interim bail of over 3,300 undertrial prisoners by 30 days to de-congest jails here in the wake of the persisting coronavirus pandemic.

details.title: Permission to reopen from today, but no big screen movies in Maharashtra yet
details.content: The Maharashtra government allowed theatres to reopen from Thursday but it might be some more days before audiences here can get to watch a movie on the big screen with hall owners saying they need till at least next week to get things ready.

details.title: Domestic flights' cap would be increased to 70-75% of pre-COVID levels as traffic surges: Centre
details.content:
The cap on the number of domestic flights that Indian airlines are permitted to operate would be increased to 70-75 per cent of their pre-COVID levels as the passenger traffic surges, the Ministry of Civil Aviation (MOCA) said on Thursday.
(READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: Despite COVID-19 pandemic, property tax payments soar in Chennai
details.content:
Despite the pandemic, the highest number of property tax bills have been paid for the month of October in Chennai, when compared to the last four years. According to Chennai corporation data, a total of 1,38,187 property tax bills have been paid and a collection of Rs 91 crores made for October which is the first month of the second half year.
(READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: UGC notifies guidelines for reopening of universities, colleges
details.content:
For central universities and other centrally funded higher education institutions, the decision for reopening of campuses has been left to the Vice Chancellors and heads. However, for state universities and colleges, the respective state governments will have to take a call, the guidelines said.
(READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: Madras high court Chief Justice hospitalised after developing virus symptoms
details.content:
• Chief Justice Amreshwar Pratap Sahi was admitted to Rajiv Gandhi Government General Hospital in Chennai with symptoms of Covid-19
  • Confirming the news a senior doctor at the hospital said, "The Chief Justice came to the hospital with complaints of cough and tiredness. Swab sample has been taken and the result is awaited. But the CT scan findings suggest lung infection. So, doctors suspect Covid and he has been admitted in a ward for Covid-suspect patients."
  • The chief justice presided over physical court hearing on Thursday
  • Later in the evening he visited the hospital after he showed symptoms

(ENS Inputs)

details.title: Suburban train services to resume in Bengal from November 11
details.content:
Railways will resume suburban services in three divisions in West Bengal from November 11, Railway Minister Piyush Goyal said Thursday. The services in Eastern Railway's Sealdah and Howrah divisions and South Eastern Railways Howrah-Kharagpur division to be run from November 11 will be demand based, officials said.
(READ FULL REPORT HERE)
